parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post mentions PSD and PNL, it does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name or clearly identifiable attribute.  It criticizes the general governance of these parties over a period of time, not a specific candidate's actions or policies within the current election.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is not directed at a specific individual but rather aims to reach a broad audience. The reach estimate further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True, but weak. The post's objective is debatable. While it criticizes the PSD and PNL, it doesn't explicitly advocate for or against any specific candidate in the current parliamentary elections. The criticism could be interpreted as an attempt to influence voters negatively towards these parties, but it lacks a direct call to action or endorsement of an alternative. The connection to the current election is tenuous.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It presents a strongly opinionated and biased view of the PSD and PNL's governance, without presenting counterarguments or evidence to support its claims. It reads more like political commentary than factual reporting.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post expresses a strong opinion, it's presented as a statement of fact rather than a personal opinion. The lack of personal pronouns and the assertive tone suggest an attempt to present the criticism as objective truth, rather than a subjective viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1220621552349875</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post walks a fine line. It criticizes the PSD and PNL, which could indirectly influence voters during the election period. However, it lacks a direct call to action or endorsement of a specific candidate. The connection to the current election is weak, and the content is more akin to political commentary than direct electoral propaganda.  The lack of a specific candidate mention weakens the case for a violation.  While the criticism could be seen as negatively impacting the image of the mentioned parties, it doesn't explicitly promote a specific alternative.  The "in dubio pro reo" principle should be applied here.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Fundatia "Perfect Civic"</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
